channel.title: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
channel.description:
My system has the following specifications
QT Wallet, Client Wallet (and version) or Web wallet: **Web wallet** Operating System and version: win10 If web wallet browser name and version: chrome ver.77 and ie11 If desktop wallet (Qt or Client) block # of your client and # of connections:
The problem I am having is ....
i can't send bitbay other wallet. If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
tx is below. ------------------------------------------------------------- 
tx verify --------------------------------------------------------------- #### Transaction Script
The above script has been decoded
**Version** : 1
**Transaction Time** : Fri, 25 Oct 2019 01:41:25 GMT
**Transaction Size** : 966 *bytes*
**Lock time** : Block height 0 - This is a Time Locked Address, unlock the funds after this Date/Block.
What should i do?

item.title: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
item.dc:creator: @dzimbeck David Zimbeck
item.description:
@dzimbeck wrote:

Haha yeah it took me a while to sync since I was using a different laptop to check the transaction. Okay well I can check it manually and check our nodes manually. Thanks for your patience glad to see it is sorted out. You could probably log back into the web wallet to see if balance updated that would also tell us if we were out of sync.

Read full topic
item.source: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"

item.title: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
item.dc:creator: @xtalmino
item.description:
@xtalmino wrote:

QT wallet sync took a very long time.
Now, I have successfully transferred using QT wallet.
Thanks. Good day.

Read full topic

item.title: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
item.dc:creator: @dzimbeck David Zimbeck
item.description:
@dzimbeck wrote:

Oh hey it was slow to sync and then I had to change hotels. Im travelling right now. However I should know this week. Like I said if its urgent you can import the private key into the QT wallet. Thanks for your patience.

item.source: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"

item.title: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
item.dc:creator: @dzimbeck David Zimbeck
item.description:
@dzimbeck wrote:

Hey I am checking your transaction I’m just syncing. It might just be something with one of the web nodes which we might have to update. I will know by tomorrow. No matter what, you can always import the web wallets private key into the QT client if you are in a rush to move the coins. You can see all of that info on the backup page.

Read full topic
item.source: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"

item.title: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
item.dc:creator: @xtalmino
item.description:
@xtalmino wrote:

By September, withdrawals were normal.
I sent bitbay to novaexchange and withdraw is ok.
Around October, due to the end of novaexchange,
I deposited from novaexchange into my web wallet.
And now I have a problem withdrawing in web wallet.
help me please.

Read full topic

item.title: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
item.dc:creator: @xtalmino
item.description:
@xtalmino wrote:

I try to send 1000 bay and set 1 bay fee.
But, result is same.

image.png1320x878 47 KB

item.source: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"

item.title: If I try to send bay to another wallet, result is "TX rejected"
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Hi,

The “tx rejected” error is commonly due to sending a payment with too small of a fee. Can you please try sending it again, and make sure that the fee is not less than .02 BAY? Let me know if that works.

- tradersnow

Read full topic
